intro: Carpoceras ceratocarpum, commonly known as the horned burr, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, and often prickly fruiting bodies that resemble horns or burs. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters, while the leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tinge. The plant is known for its ability to spread through seed dispersal by attachment to animals or clothing.
